channel.title: Webclient help! d:
channel.description:
Okay, so I got this whole thingy majig down, and all. But it freezes at... 'Starting up' :P http://demonzscape3.webs.com/WebClient.htm Theres the site. [code]
DemonZscape




Warning: May take a few minutes to Download Cache, but be paient and it'll come quicker than you know!

Also, it may be slow for java, but it'll come soon. :D
[/code] That's the coding that's on the page, any help would be much appreachated. o.O Also, how to fix the SUPER slow Java screen? x)

item.title: Webclient help! d:
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Demon6994, post:9, topic:393177”]If you’re so smart, help me out then.
Considering the fact, the computer I do use, is able to hold the .jar file that I have made, the location in which the cache goes goes to desktop, no clue why, other than that, it works just fine. >_> And for future reasons, remember, this is a HELP section, not a flame at me telling me all this other crap. -.- I’ve been going in and out of TuT’s for this webclient. And all of them seem to fail. So I figured i’d go and look for someone who actually knew how to and get help from them. -.-[/quote]

Are you hosting the webclient on your computer?

Read full topic

And all of them seem to fail. So I figured i’d go and look for someone who actually knew how to and get help from them. -.-

item.title: Webclient help! d:
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Demon6994:

Okay, I did that and it still fails. v.v

Because he’s an idiot.

You can’t use a normal file host for your client. You can’t use uppit/megaupload/fileden/filehippo/etc. You need DIRECT access to the jar. The easiest way to do this is have the client jar on the same machine as the webclient page.

You also must make sure that the cache location is available on ALL computers, and that you have a tested way of downloading the cache.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Demon6994 wrote:

So instead of having the link to fileden there or whatever, have it set like <applet name="DemonZscape" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> Like so? Then upload it onto the webs i’m using and it should work?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Wildyscape562 Wildyscape562
item.description:
@Wildyscape562 wrote:

You upload it to your file uploader, then you put client.jar where you have your .jar on fileden just replace it and your good to go.
